boardgame.name: Action Stations! Naval Wargame Rules for Coastal Forces 1914-1953 (Fourth Edition)
boardgame.description:
Action Stations ! Naval Wargame Rules for Coastal Forces, 1914-1953

These rules are designed to fight actions in the First and Second World Wars and the Korean War. They provide the opportunity to refight skirmishes in the Channel, the Mediterranean and the Pacific with MTB attacks on Convoys and similar furious engagements.

A SET OF QUICK REFERENCE SHEETS IS AVAILABLE THROUGH THE PUBLISHER'S WEBSITE


miniatures scale: 1/600 or 1/1200
Complexity: 8/10
Level of detail: 7/10
Dice required: D10, D6


This edition of the rules has been updated and now uses the initiative system that appears in other products in the A&AGE range.

Play alternates between the two sides, with the initiative winner deciding who will move first each turn.
The time scale in the turn is now about 40 seconds, and the models move 1cm per knot on the table.
The speed that vessels can move is regulated by the concept of Speed Settings, based on 1/4’s of the ship’s speed, and therefore constraining the model’s movement.



Shooting now takes the rate of fire of a weapon mount into account in more detail, and gun mounts may roll more than 1 dice to hit. Guns with slow rates of fire are penalised. As the game turn is now longer, the damage inflicted has been increased, and there is a bit more differentiation between different gun calibres.
Hull Damage and Special Damage is evaluated separately for each hit. Some weapons will not damage the hull but could affect the ship in other ways. You cannot sink a destroyer with a machine gun, but you could suppress the gun crews.
Torpedoes are represented by individual tracks, so the player needs to have a good aim and be able to judge the distance to the target.



The rules also allow for the use of Aircraft, Submarines, Minefields and Armed Merchant ships.
The data annexe has been expanded and now covers over 250 vessels and 200 aircraft.



Game support material (template, record sheet, erratas) is available to download on the publisher's website.


Turn Sequence:

Determine initiative
Movement Phase: a)drifting vessels / b)Contact Markers and Ships / c)aircraft
Spotting
Damage Control and Repairs
Shoot guns, attack using aircraft
Torpedo attacks a) Advance existing tracks b) Launch new tracks c) Resolve any torpedo attacks
End Phase


—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Azimuth: Explore. Camp. Settle
boardgame.description:
Follow your inner adventurer and explore uncharted lands in the 16th century to create a new frontier colony. Roll your dice and use them wisely to explore, camp, and settle your way to victory. Explore areas to benefit yourself while disturbing other explorers. Make yourself a camp for better reach, and build your settlement in a well-charted area for victory!

Start the game after the direction of the compass is determined, flip all the 7 face-down tiles and every player places their starting camp on whichever tiles they like. Roll the dice to determine what actions you can take. Each player takes turns to use the dice with the corresponding direction of the hexagon compass to explore (place a tile) or place a camp. You can sacrifice dice to reroll for the rest of the unused dice regardless of your turn.

Placing a camp expands your starting point for exploration and potentially develops into a settlement for victory points. To develop a settlement you need dice with the corresponding number of pips according to the settlement score which is determined by the terrain adjacency of the mentioned settlement, place the dice used as settlement below the pre-existing camp. every player can only develop a settlement once per round. after the players use all of their dice, the round ends and take all the dice not used as a settlement, and start a new round by rolling the dice.

The end game triggers after 2 stack of exploration tiles exhausted or a player have created 4 settlements, finish the present round as usual and starting the last round. The player with the most amount of pip from the dice used as a settlement win.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Si Anak Nakal
boardgame.description:
A group of Mouse Deer and Sheep have broken into the Timun Saving vault. Just right when about to do the deed of stealing, some of them thought to themselves "Aren't stealing is a sin?". Decide your alignment whether you want to help the thieves or sabotage them! Bluff your way through the cards to make yourself the victor.

Set up the game by placing the score tracker, shuffling the cards, exclude 1 card randomly, and give all the player 1 card. the rest of the cards are placed face down as the vaults. The first player begins by picking any face-down card in the vault, from the 2 cards you have in hand, you can either place one face down and nothing happens, or place them face up then activate the card’s effect. The game ends after all the cards in the vault are opened or game-ending card is revealed in the vault. The score is determined by the card left in the player’s hand. The first player that has achieved 15 points wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Kopi Dash
boardgame.description:
Do you have what it takes to be a lightning-fast barista?
A super-fast card game where you alone or with other make drinks under 5 minutes! Play the right ingredient cards to fulfill the customer's orders. Pick your card wisely and avoid wasting time, you need to be FAST!

Set up the game by shuffling each customer and ingredients deck. The customer deck is set to face down and the ingredients deck divided into 2 face-up stacks. Give every player ingredients card according to the number of players involved, and set up a 5-minute timer. The timer starts after the first customer card is opened. Every player contributes to fulfilling the customer’s order by placing the right ingredients cards. refill ingredients card from the stacks every time the amount of card in hand decreased. If an order cannot be fulfilled, a player can discard their card in hand face down into the used ingredients pile and refill their hand from the ingredients stack, then start the order from the beginning. After the stacks of ingredients exhausted, take all the used ingredients card and do a 10-second shuffle then divide them by 2 stacks as usual. The game ends after either the players have completed all the orders which resulted in a win or the timer ends which the players lose.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Escape Room: Das Spiel 2
boardgame.description:
Escape Room The Game is the game where you need to work together to solve puzzles and to find hidden clues. It’s always a race against the clock; you only have 60 minutes to escape. The Chrono Decoder counts down, creates the right atmosphere and tells you when you can use hints. In this game you either win together or you lose together. All players have to get the best out of themselves. To solve riddles and puzzles in time, teamwork is the key to success. Unbelievable how quickly 60 minutes pass in the heat of the moment.

4 NEW ADVENTURES, CAN YOU ESCAPE IN TIME?
Are you already familiar with Escape Room the Game? Feel the tension of an Escape Room in your own living room again with the four new adventures of Escape Room The Game 2.

Have you not played Escape Room the Game yet? Then you can expect a challenging and unpredictable game!

The German edition contains the following adventures: Alice in Wonderland, Another Dimension, Wild West Express and The Break-In. The last 2 adventures are new ones and not included in the Dutch, Korean, and Spanish version which is found here: Escape Room: The Game 2.
.............................................................

The Break-In

Heute Nacht ist es endlich soweit! Lange habt ihr euch auf euren Einbruch in das Lockholm Museum vorbereitet. Das Ziel? Ein unbezahlbares Kunstwerk der berühmten Künstlerin Esa Cape. Stehlt die Skulptur, versteckt euch vor den Wachen und entkommt ungesehen wieder aus dem Museum, bevor ihr erwischt werdet!

Alice in Wonderland

„Ich komme zu spat!”, ruft ein weißer Hase, während er auf eine Uhr sieht. „Die Teeparty beginnt bald!“

Ein sprechender Hase? Ihr seht nicht richtig! Er hoppelt in ein kleines Loch, und ihr folgt ihm hinterher. Als ihr in einem Raum mit einem riesigen Tisch landet, wird euch klar: hier irgendwo ist der Zugang ins Wunderland! Entkommt in einer Stunde, oder bleibt für immer hier!

Wild West Express

Während einer gemütlichen Zugfahrt nach Escapetown wird der Zug von Banditen überfallen. Sie haben die Lok übernommen und wollen den Zug in einer Stunde in einen Abgrund steuern. Das würde ein böses Ende nehmen…

Überwältigt die Banditen, übernehmt die Kontrolle über die Lokomotive und stoppt den Zug, bevor er den Abgrund erreicht!

Another Dimension

Seit mehreren Monaten passieren komische Dinge in Lockholm. Ihr seid in die nahe Militärbasis eingebrochen um den mysteriösen Ereignissen auf die Spur zu kommen. Doch was ihr dort vorfindet, könnt ihr kaum glauben… hier gibt es ein Portal in eine andere Dimension! Wer wagt sich zu einer besonderen Begegnung?
